trans-unit.source: Single Sign-on (SAML Protocol)
trans-unit.target: Single Sign-on (SAML Protocol)

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory supports the SAML 2.0 web browser single sign-on (SSO) profile.
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory supports the SAML 2.0 web browser single sign-on (SSO) profile.

trans-unit.source: To request that Azure Active Directory authenticate a user, the cloud service (the service provider) must use an HTTP Redirect binding to pass an <system>AuthnRequest</system> (authentication request) element to Azure Active Directory (the identity provider).
trans-unit.target: To request that Azure Active Directory authenticate a user, the cloud service (the service provider) must use an HTTP Redirect binding to pass an <system>AuthnRequest</system> (authentication request) element to Azure Active Directory (the identity provider).

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory uses an HTTP Post binding to post a <system>Response</system> element to the cloud service.
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory uses an HTTP Post binding to post a <system>Response</system> element to the cloud service.

trans-unit.source: This topic describes the SAML 2.0 authentication requests and responses that Azure Active Directory supports for single sign-on.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes the SAML 2.0 authentication requests and responses that Azure Active Directory supports for single sign-on.

trans-unit.source: It lists and describes the required, optional, ignored, and unsupported elements and attributes, and value requirements.
trans-unit.target: It lists and describes the required, optional, ignored, and unsupported elements and attributes, and value requirements.

trans-unit.source: This diagram depicts the workflow of the Azure Active Directory authentication process for single sign-on.
trans-unit.target: This diagram depicts the workflow of the Azure Active Directory authentication process for single sign-on.

trans-unit.source: AuthnRequest
trans-unit.target: AuthnRequest

trans-unit.source: This section describes the elements in a SAML 2.0 authorization request to Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: This section describes the elements in a SAML 2.0 authorization request to Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: The following is a sample SAML 2.0 <system>AuthnRequest</system> element with only the required attributes.
trans-unit.target: The following is a sample SAML 2.0 <system>AuthnRequest</system> element with only the required attributes.

trans-unit.source: AuthnRequest Element
trans-unit.target: AuthnRequest Element

trans-unit.source: To request a user authentication, cloud services send an <system>AuthnRequest</system> element to Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: To request a user authentication, cloud services send an <system>AuthnRequest</system> element to Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: The following list describes the required, optional, and ignored attributes when the <system>AuthnRequest</system> element is used in this context.
trans-unit.target: The following list describes the required, optional, and ignored attributes when the <system>AuthnRequest</system> element is used in this context.

trans-unit.source: Required Attributes
trans-unit.target: Required Attributes

trans-unit.source: <system>ID</system>.
trans-unit.target: <system>ID</system>.

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory uses the value of the <system>ID</system> attribute to populate the <system>InResponseTo</system> attribute of the SAML <system>Response</system> that it returns.
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory uses the value of the <system>ID</system> attribute to populate the <system>InResponseTo</system> attribute of the SAML <system>Response</system> that it returns.

trans-unit.source: The SAML specification requires that the value of ID must not begin with a number.
trans-unit.target: The SAML specification requires that the value of ID must not begin with a number.

trans-unit.source: A common strategy to generate a value for the ID attribute is to prepend a predefined string, such as "id", to the string representation of a GUID.
trans-unit.target: A common strategy to generate a value for the ID attribute is to prepend a predefined string, such as "id", to the string representation of a GUID.

trans-unit.source: <system>Version</system>.
trans-unit.target: <system>Version</system>.

trans-unit.source: Set the value of the version attribute to <system>2.0</system>.
trans-unit.target: Set the value of the version attribute to <system>2.0</system>.

trans-unit.source: This value is required.
trans-unit.target: This value is required.

trans-unit.source: <system>IssueInstant</system>.
trans-unit.target: <system>IssueInstant</system>.

trans-unit.source: Set the value of the <system>IssueInstant</system> attribute to a <system>DateTime</system> string with a Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) value and <externalLink><linkText>round-trip format ("o")</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/az4se3k1.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: Set the value of the <system>IssueInstant</system> attribute to a <system>DateTime</system> string with a Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) value and <externalLink><linkText>round-trip format ("o")</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/az4se3k1.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory expects a Datetime value of this type, but does not evaluate or use the value.
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory expects a Datetime value of this type, but does not evaluate or use the value.

trans-unit.source: Optional Attributes
trans-unit.target: Optional Attributes

trans-unit.source: <system>AssertionConsumerServiceURL</system>.
trans-unit.target: <system>AssertionConsumerServiceURL</system>.

trans-unit.source: If provided, the value of the <system>AssertionConsumerServiceURL</system> attribute must exactly match the value of the <system>RedirectUri</system> of the service principal object that represents the cloud service in Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: If provided, the value of the <system>AssertionConsumerServiceURL</system> attribute must exactly match the value of the <system>RedirectUri</system> of the service principal object that represents the cloud service in Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <system>ForceAuthn</system>: If provided, set the value to <system>false</system>.
trans-unit.target: <system>ForceAuthn</system>: If provided, set the value to <system>false</system>.

trans-unit.source: Any other value causes an error.
trans-unit.target: Any other value causes an error.

trans-unit.source: <system>IsPassive</system>: If provided, set the value to <system>false</system>.
trans-unit.target: <system>IsPassive</system>: If provided, set the value to <system>false</system>.

trans-unit.source: Any other value causes an error.
trans-unit.target: Any other value causes an error.

trans-unit.source: <system>Ignored Attributes</system>: Consent, Destination, AssertionConsumerServiceIndex, AttributeConsumerServiceIndex, ProviderName
trans-unit.target: <system>Ignored Attributes</system>: Consent, Destination, AssertionConsumerServiceIndex, AttributeConsumerServiceIndex, ProviderName

trans-unit.source: Conditions Element in AuthnRequest
trans-unit.target: Conditions Element in AuthnRequest

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory ignores the <system>Conditions</system> element in an <system>AuthnRequest</system> element.
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory ignores the <system>Conditions</system> element in an <system>AuthnRequest</system> element.

trans-unit.source: Issuer Element in AuthnRequest
trans-unit.target: Issuer Element in AuthnRequest

trans-unit.source: The <system>Issuer</system> element is required in any <system>AuthnRequest</system> element sent to Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: The <system>Issuer</system> element is required in any <system>AuthnRequest</system> element sent to Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: The following SAML excerpt shows a sample Issuer element.
trans-unit.target: The following SAML excerpt shows a sample Issuer element.

trans-unit.source: The value of the <system>Issuer</system> element must exactly match one of the <system>ServicePrincipalNames</system> in the service principal object that represents the cloud service in Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: The value of the <system>Issuer</system> element must exactly match one of the <system>ServicePrincipalNames</system> in the service principal object that represents the cloud service in Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: Set the value of the Issuer element to the <system>App ID URI</system> that is specified during application registration.
trans-unit.target: Set the value of the Issuer element to the <system>App ID URI</system> that is specified during application registration.

trans-unit.source: NameIDPolicy Element in AuthnRequest
trans-unit.target: NameIDPolicy Element in AuthnRequest

trans-unit.source: The <system>NameIDPolicy</system> element, which requests a particular name ID format, is optional in <system>AuthnRequest</system> elements sent to Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: The <system>NameIDPolicy</system> element, which requests a particular name ID format, is optional in <system>AuthnRequest</system> elements sent to Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: If <system>NameIDPolicy</system> is provided, you can include its optional <system>Format</system> attribute.
trans-unit.target: If <system>NameIDPolicy</system> is provided, you can include its optional <system>Format</system> attribute.

trans-unit.source: If provided, the <system>Format</system> attribute must have one of the following values.
trans-unit.target: If provided, the <system>Format</system> attribute must have one of the following values.

trans-unit.source: Any other value results in an error.
trans-unit.target: Any other value results in an error.

trans-unit.source: <codeInline>"urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:nameid-format:persistent"</codeInline>: Azure Active Directory issues the NameID claim as a pairwise identifier.
trans-unit.target: <codeInline>"urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:nameid-format:persistent"</codeInline>: Azure Active Directory issues the NameID claim as a pairwise identifier.

trans-unit.source: <codeInline>"urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.1:nameid-format:emailAddress"</codeInline>: Azure Active Directory issues the NameID claim in e-mail address format.
trans-unit.target: <codeInline>"urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.1:nameid-format:emailAddress"</codeInline>: Azure Active Directory issues the NameID claim in e-mail address format.

trans-unit.source: <codeInline>"urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.1:nameid-format:unspecified"</codeInline>: This value permits Azure Active Directory to select the claim format.
trans-unit.target: <codeInline>"urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.1:nameid-format:unspecified"</codeInline>: This value permits Azure Active Directory to select the claim format.

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory issues the NameID as a pairwise identifier.
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory issues the NameID as a pairwise identifier.

trans-unit.source: Do not include the <system>SPNameQualifier</system> attribute.
trans-unit.target: Do not include the <system>SPNameQualifier</system> attribute.

trans-unit.source: If you include the <system>AllowCreate</system> attribute, Azure Active Directory doesn't return an error, but the element is ignored.
trans-unit.target: If you include the <system>AllowCreate</system> attribute, Azure Active Directory doesn't return an error, but the element is ignored.

trans-unit.source: The following is an example of a valid <system>NameIdPolicy</system> element.
trans-unit.target: The following is an example of a valid <system>NameIdPolicy</system> element.

trans-unit.source: RequestedAuthnContext Element
trans-unit.target: RequestedAuthnContext Element

trans-unit.source: The <system>RequestedAuthnContext</system> element specifies the desired authentication methods.
trans-unit.target: The <system>RequestedAuthnContext</system> element specifies the desired authentication methods.

trans-unit.source: It is optional in <system>AuthnRequest</system> elements sent to Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: It is optional in <system>AuthnRequest</system> elements sent to Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory supports only one <system>AuthnContextClassRef</system> (request of authentication context class) value, <codeInline>"urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:ac:classes:Password"</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory supports only one <system>AuthnContextClassRef</system> (request of authentication context class) value, <codeInline>"urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:ac:classes:Password"</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: Scoping Element in AuthnRequest
trans-unit.target: Scoping Element in AuthnRequest

trans-unit.source: The <system>Scoping</system> element, which includes a list of identity providers, is optional in <system>AuthnRequest</system> elements sent to Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: The <system>Scoping</system> element, which includes a list of identity providers, is optional in <system>AuthnRequest</system> elements sent to Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: Do not include the <system>ProxyCount</system> attribute, <system>IDPList</system> option, or the <system>RequesterID</system> element, in the <system>Scoping</system> element of an <system>AuthnRequest</system> sent to Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: Do not include the <system>ProxyCount</system> attribute, <system>IDPList</system> option, or the <system>RequesterID</system> element, in the <system>Scoping</system> element of an <system>AuthnRequest</system> sent to Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: They are not supported.
trans-unit.target: They are not supported.

trans-unit.source: Signature Element in AuthnRequest
trans-unit.target: Signature Element in AuthnRequest

trans-unit.source: Do not include a Signature element in an <system>AuthnRequest</system> sent to Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: Do not include a Signature element in an <system>AuthnRequest</system> sent to Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory does not support signed authentication requests.
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory does not support signed authentication requests.

trans-unit.source: Subject Element in AuthnRequest
trans-unit.target: Subject Element in AuthnRequest

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory ignores Subject element of <system>AuthnRequest</system> elements.
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory ignores Subject element of <system>AuthnRequest</system> elements.

trans-unit.source: Response
trans-unit.target: Response

trans-unit.source: When a requested sign-on completes successfully, Azure Active Directory posts a response to the cloud service (service provider).
trans-unit.target: When a requested sign-on completes successfully, Azure Active Directory posts a response to the cloud service (service provider).

trans-unit.source: This section describes the format of the response.
trans-unit.target: This section describes the format of the response.

trans-unit.source: The following SAML sample shows the response to a successful sign-on attempt.
trans-unit.target: The following SAML sample shows the response to a successful sign-on attempt.

trans-unit.source: Response Element
trans-unit.target: Response Element

trans-unit.source: The <system>Response</system> element includes the results of the authorization request.
trans-unit.target: The <system>Response</system> element includes the results of the authorization request.

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory includes the <system>ID</system>, <system>Version</system> and <system>IssueInstant</system> attributes of the <system>Response</system> element.
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory includes the <system>ID</system>, <system>Version</system> and <system>IssueInstant</system> attributes of the <system>Response</system> element.

trans-unit.source: It also sets the values of the following attributes.
trans-unit.target: It also sets the values of the following attributes.

trans-unit.source: <system>Destination</system>: When sign-on completes successfully, Azure Active Directory sets the value of the <system>Destination</system> attribute to the <system>RedirectUri</system> of the service provider.
trans-unit.target: <system>Destination</system>: When sign-on completes successfully, Azure Active Directory sets the value of the <system>Destination</system> attribute to the <system>RedirectUri</system> of the service provider.

trans-unit.source: <system>InResponseTo</system>: Azure Active Directory always sets the value of <system>InResponseTo</system> attribute to the value of the <system>ID</system> attribute of the <system>AuthnRequest</system> element that initiated the response.
trans-unit.target: <system>InResponseTo</system>: Azure Active Directory always sets the value of <system>InResponseTo</system> attribute to the value of the <system>ID</system> attribute of the <system>AuthnRequest</system> element that initiated the response.

trans-unit.source: Issuer Element in Response Element
trans-unit.target: Issuer Element in Response Element

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory sets the value of <system>Issuer</system> element to <codeInline>"https://login.microsoftonline.com/%%amp;lt;TenantIDGUID%%amp;gt;/"</codeInline> where <TenantIDGUID> is the Tenant ID of the Azure Active Directory tenant.
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory sets the value of <system>Issuer</system> element to <codeInline>"https://login.microsoftonline.com/%%amp;lt;TenantIDGUID%%amp;gt;/"</codeInline> where <TenantIDGUID> is the Tenant ID of the Azure Active Directory tenant.

trans-unit.source: The following SAML excerpt shows a sample <system>Issuer</system> element.
trans-unit.target: The following SAML excerpt shows a sample <system>Issuer</system> element.

trans-unit.source: Signature Element in Response
trans-unit.target: Signature Element in Response

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory signs the <system>Response</system> element in response to a successful sign-on.
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory signs the <system>Response</system> element in response to a successful sign-on.

trans-unit.source: The <system>Signature</system> element in the <system>Response</system> element contains a digital signature that the cloud service can use to authenticate the source and verity the integrity of the response.
trans-unit.target: The <system>Signature</system> element in the <system>Response</system> element contains a digital signature that the cloud service can use to authenticate the source and verity the integrity of the response.

trans-unit.source: To generate this digital signature, Azure Active Directory uses the signing key specified in the <system>IDPSSODescriptor</system> element of its metadata document.
trans-unit.target: To generate this digital signature, Azure Active Directory uses the signing key specified in the <system>IDPSSODescriptor</system> element of its metadata document.

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory also signs the <system>Assertion</system> element in the <system>Response</system> element, but the two <system>Signature</system> elements are independent.
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory also signs the <system>Assertion</system> element in the <system>Response</system> element, but the two <system>Signature</system> elements are independent.

trans-unit.source: The following SAML excerpt shows a sample <system>Signature</system> element.
trans-unit.target: The following SAML excerpt shows a sample <system>Signature</system> element.

trans-unit.source: In this sample, the digital signature is replaced by ellipses.
trans-unit.target: In this sample, the digital signature is replaced by ellipses.

trans-unit.source: For more information about the <system>IDPSSODescriptor</system> element, see <link xlink:href="590b6fd4-d6c7-43db-b6fa-c03f2718ea2e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Application Registration and Metadata Exchange</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about the <system>IDPSSODescriptor</system> element, see <link xlink:href="590b6fd4-d6c7-43db-b6fa-c03f2718ea2e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Application Registration and Metadata Exchange</link>.

trans-unit.source: Status Element in Response
trans-unit.target: Status Element in Response

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory uses the <system>Status</system> element to convey the success or failure of sign-on.
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory uses the <system>Status</system> element to convey the success or failure of sign-on.

trans-unit.source: The <system>StatusCode</system> element in the <system>Status</system> element contains a code or a set of nested codes that represent the status of the request.
trans-unit.target: The <system>StatusCode</system> element in the <system>Status</system> element contains a code or a set of nested codes that represent the status of the request.

trans-unit.source: The <system>Status</system> element also includes the <system>StatusMessage</system> element, which contains custom error messages that are generated during the sign-on process.
trans-unit.target: The <system>Status</system> element also includes the <system>StatusMessage</system> element, which contains custom error messages that are generated during the sign-on process.

trans-unit.source: For more information about the authentication errors that Azure Active Directory returns, see <link xlink:href="8a075750-c6cf-46fe-916d-0e39c5178354" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Authentication Protocol Error Reference</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about the authentication errors that Azure Active Directory returns, see <link xlink:href="8a075750-c6cf-46fe-916d-0e39c5178354" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Authentication Protocol Error Reference</link>.

trans-unit.source: The following SAML excerpt shows a sample SAML response to an unsuccessful sign-on attempt.
trans-unit.target: The following SAML excerpt shows a sample SAML response to an unsuccessful sign-on attempt.

trans-unit.source: Assertion Element in Response
trans-unit.target: Assertion Element in Response

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory sets the following attributes on the <system>Assertion</system> element in the <system>Response</system> element: ID, IssueInstant, and Version.
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory sets the following attributes on the <system>Assertion</system> element in the <system>Response</system> element: ID, IssueInstant, and Version.

trans-unit.source: Issuer Element in Assertion
trans-unit.target: Issuer Element in Assertion

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory sets the value of the <system>Issuer</system> element in the <system>Assertion</system> element to <codeInline>https://sts.windows.net/%%amp;lt;TenantIDGUID%%amp;gt;/</codeInline> where <TenantIDGUID> is the Tenant ID of the Azure Active Directory tenant.
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory sets the value of the <system>Issuer</system> element in the <system>Assertion</system> element to <codeInline>https://sts.windows.net/%%amp;lt;TenantIDGUID%%amp;gt;/</codeInline> where <TenantIDGUID> is the Tenant ID of the Azure Active Directory tenant.

trans-unit.source: The following SAML excerpt shows a sample <system>Issuer</system> element in the Assertion element.
trans-unit.target: The following SAML excerpt shows a sample <system>Issuer</system> element in the Assertion element.

trans-unit.source: Signature Element in Assertion
trans-unit.target: Signature Element in Assertion

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory signs the assertion in a response to a successful sign-on.
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory signs the assertion in a response to a successful sign-on.

trans-unit.source: The <system>Signature</system> element in the <system>Assertion</system> element contains a digital signature that the cloud service can use to authenticate the source verify the integrity of the assertion.
trans-unit.target: The <system>Signature</system> element in the <system>Assertion</system> element contains a digital signature that the cloud service can use to authenticate the source verify the integrity of the assertion.

trans-unit.source: To generate this digital signature, Azure Active Directory uses the signing key specified in the <system>IDPSSODescriptor</system> element of its metadata document.
trans-unit.target: To generate this digital signature, Azure Active Directory uses the signing key specified in the <system>IDPSSODescriptor</system> element of its metadata document.

trans-unit.source: For more information about the <system>IDPSSODescriptor</system> element, see <link xlink:href="590b6fd4-d6c7-43db-b6fa-c03f2718ea2e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Application Registration and Metadata Exchange</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about the <system>IDPSSODescriptor</system> element, see <link xlink:href="590b6fd4-d6c7-43db-b6fa-c03f2718ea2e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Application Registration and Metadata Exchange</link>.

trans-unit.source: The following SAML excerpt shows a sample <system>Signature</system> element in the Assertion element.
trans-unit.target: The following SAML excerpt shows a sample <system>Signature</system> element in the Assertion element.

trans-unit.source: In this sample, the digital signature is replaced by ellipses.
trans-unit.target: In this sample, the digital signature is replaced by ellipses.

trans-unit.source: Subject Element in Assertion
trans-unit.target: Subject Element in Assertion

trans-unit.source: The <system>Subject</system> element of the <system>Assertion</system> element in an Azure Active Directory response specifies the principal that is the subject of the statements in the assertion.
trans-unit.target: The <system>Subject</system> element of the <system>Assertion</system> element in an Azure Active Directory response specifies the principal that is the subject of the statements in the assertion.

trans-unit.source: The <system>Subject</system> element in a response returned by Azure Active Directory contains the <system>NameId</system> and <system>SubjectConfirmation</system> elements.
trans-unit.target: The <system>Subject</system> element in a response returned by Azure Active Directory contains the <system>NameId</system> and <system>SubjectConfirmation</system> elements.

trans-unit.source: The value of <system>NameId</system> element is an opaque and immutable identifier that represents the authenticated user.
trans-unit.target: The value of <system>NameId</system> element is an opaque and immutable identifier that represents the authenticated user.

trans-unit.source: The <system>NameId</system> value is a targeted identifier that is directed only to the service provider that is the audience for the token.
trans-unit.target: The <system>NameId</system> value is a targeted identifier that is directed only to the service provider that is the audience for the token.

trans-unit.source: The <system>NameId</system> value is persistent; it can be revoked, but is never reassigned.
trans-unit.target: The <system>NameId</system> value is persistent; it can be revoked, but is never reassigned.

trans-unit.source: It is also opaque, that is, it does not reveal anything about the user and it cannot be used as an identifier for attribute queries.
trans-unit.target: It is also opaque, that is, it does not reveal anything about the user and it cannot be used as an identifier for attribute queries.

trans-unit.source: The following SAML excerpt shows a sample <system>Subject</system> element.
trans-unit.target: The following SAML excerpt shows a sample <system>Subject</system> element.

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory sets the <system>Method</system> attribute of the <system>SubjectConfirmation</system> element only to <codeInline>"urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:cm:bearer"</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory sets the <system>Method</system> attribute of the <system>SubjectConfirmation</system> element only to <codeInline>"urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:cm:bearer"</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: Conditions Element in Assertion
trans-unit.target: Conditions Element in Assertion

trans-unit.source: The <system>Conditions</system> element in the <system>Assertion</system> element specifies conditions that define the acceptable use of SAML assertions.
trans-unit.target: The <system>Conditions</system> element in the <system>Assertion</system> element specifies conditions that define the acceptable use of SAML assertions.

trans-unit.source: The following SAML excerpt shows a sample <system>Conditions</system> element.
trans-unit.target: The following SAML excerpt shows a sample <system>Conditions</system> element.

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory sets the <system>NotBefore</system> and <system>NotOnOrAfter</system> attributes of the <system>Conditions</system> element of the <system>Assertion</system> element.
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory sets the <system>NotBefore</system> and <system>NotOnOrAfter</system> attributes of the <system>Conditions</system> element of the <system>Assertion</system> element.

trans-unit.source: These attributes specify the interval during which the assertion is valid.
trans-unit.target: These attributes specify the interval during which the assertion is valid.

trans-unit.source: The value of the <system>NotBefore</system> attribute is equal to or slightly (less than a second) later than the value of <system>IssueInstant</system> attribute of the <system>Assertion</system> element.
trans-unit.target: The value of the <system>NotBefore</system> attribute is equal to or slightly (less than a second) later than the value of <system>IssueInstant</system> attribute of the <system>Assertion</system> element.

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory does not account for any time difference between itself and the cloud service (service provider), and does not add any buffer to this time.
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory does not account for any time difference between itself and the cloud service (service provider), and does not add any buffer to this time.

trans-unit.source: The value of the <system>NotOnOrAfter</system> attribute is 70 minutes later than the value of the <system>NotBefore</system> attribute.
trans-unit.target: The value of the <system>NotOnOrAfter</system> attribute is 70 minutes later than the value of the <system>NotBefore</system> attribute.

trans-unit.source: Audience Element in Assertion
trans-unit.target: Audience Element in Assertion

trans-unit.source: The <system>Audience</system> element appears in the <system>AudienceRestriction</system> element of the <system>Conditions</system> element in the response assertion .
trans-unit.target: The <system>Audience</system> element appears in the <system>AudienceRestriction</system> element of the <system>Conditions</system> element in the response assertion .

trans-unit.source: The value of <system>Audience</system> is a URI that identifies an intended audience.
trans-unit.target: The value of <system>Audience</system> is a URI that identifies an intended audience.

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory sets the value of the <system>Audience</system> element to the value of <system>Issuer</system> element of the <system>AuthnRequest</system> that initiated the sign-on.
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory sets the value of the <system>Audience</system> element to the value of <system>Issuer</system> element of the <system>AuthnRequest</system> that initiated the sign-on.

trans-unit.source: The issuer of the authentication request is the audience for the response.
trans-unit.target: The issuer of the authentication request is the audience for the response.

trans-unit.source: The following SAML excerpt shows a sample <system>Audience</system> element in an <system>AudienceRestriction</system> element.
trans-unit.target: The following SAML excerpt shows a sample <system>Audience</system> element in an <system>AudienceRestriction</system> element.

trans-unit.source: Like the <system>Issuer</system> value, the <system>Audience</system> value must exactly match one of the service principal names that represents the cloud service in Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: Like the <system>Issuer</system> value, the <system>Audience</system> value must exactly match one of the service principal names that represents the cloud service in Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: However, if the value of the <system>Issuer</system> element in the <system>AuthnRequest</system> element is not a URI value, the <system>Audience</system> value in the response is the <system>Issuer</system> value prefixed with <codeInline>spn:</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: However, if the value of the <system>Issuer</system> element in the <system>AuthnRequest</system> element is not a URI value, the <system>Audience</system> value in the response is the <system>Issuer</system> value prefixed with <codeInline>spn:</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: To evaluate the <system>Audience</system> value, use the value of the <system>App ID URI</system> that was specified during application registration.
trans-unit.target: To evaluate the <system>Audience</system> value, use the value of the <system>App ID URI</system> that was specified during application registration.

trans-unit.source: AttributeStatement Element in Assertion
trans-unit.target: AttributeStatement Element in Assertion

trans-unit.source: The <system>AttributeStatement</system> element contains claims about the subject or user.
trans-unit.target: The <system>AttributeStatement</system> element contains claims about the subject or user.

trans-unit.source: The following SAML excerpt is a sample <system>AttributeStatement</system> element.
trans-unit.target: The following SAML excerpt is a sample <system>AttributeStatement</system> element.

trans-unit.source: The ellipsis indicates that the element can include multiple attributes and attribute values.
trans-unit.target: The ellipsis indicates that the element can include multiple attributes and attribute values.

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory adds multiple claims about the authenticated user to the value of the <system>AttributeStatement</system> element, including <system>Name</system> and <system>ObjectIdentifier</system> claims
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory adds multiple claims about the authenticated user to the value of the <system>AttributeStatement</system> element, including <system>Name</system> and <system>ObjectIdentifier</system> claims

trans-unit.source: <system>Name Claim</system>.
trans-unit.target: <system>Name Claim</system>.

trans-unit.source: The value of the Name attribute (<codeInline>http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/05/identity/claims/name</codeInline>) is the user principal name of the authenticated user, such as <codeInline>testuser@managedtenant.com</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: The value of the Name attribute (<codeInline>http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/05/identity/claims/name</codeInline>) is the user principal name of the authenticated user, such as <codeInline>testuser@managedtenant.com</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: <system>ObjectIdentifier Claim</system>.
trans-unit.target: <system>ObjectIdentifier Claim</system>.

trans-unit.source: The value of the ObjectIdentifier attribute <codeInline>"http://schemas.microsoft.com/identity/claims/objectidentifier"</codeInline> is the <system>ObjectId</system> of the directory object that represents the authenticated user in Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: The value of the ObjectIdentifier attribute <codeInline>"http://schemas.microsoft.com/identity/claims/objectidentifier"</codeInline> is the <system>ObjectId</system> of the directory object that represents the authenticated user in Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <system>ObjectId</system> is an immutable, globally unique, and re-use safe identifier of the authenticated user.
trans-unit.target: <system>ObjectId</system> is an immutable, globally unique, and re-use safe identifier of the authenticated user.

trans-unit.source: For more information about the claim types that Azure Active Directory supports, see <legacyLink xlink:href="9d35e4bc-7b72-49d1-b723-5464eee6be2c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Supported Token and Claim Types</legacyLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about the claim types that Azure Active Directory supports, see <legacyLink xlink:href="9d35e4bc-7b72-49d1-b723-5464eee6be2c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Supported Token and Claim Types</legacyLink>.

trans-unit.source: AuthnStatement Element in Assertion
trans-unit.target: AuthnStatement Element in Assertion

trans-unit.source: The <system>AuthnStatement</system> asserts that the assertion subject was authenticated by a particular means at a particular time.
trans-unit.target: The <system>AuthnStatement</system> asserts that the assertion subject was authenticated by a particular means at a particular time.

trans-unit.source: The <system>AuthnInstant</system> attribute of the <system>AuthnStatement</system> element specifies the time at which the user authenticated with Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: The <system>AuthnInstant</system> attribute of the <system>AuthnStatement</system> element specifies the time at which the user authenticated with Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: The <system>AuthnStatement</system> element also contains the <system>AuthnContext</system> element, which specifies the class of the authentication context used to authenticate the user.
trans-unit.target: The <system>AuthnStatement</system> element also contains the <system>AuthnContext</system> element, which specifies the class of the authentication context used to authenticate the user.

trans-unit.source: The following shows a sample AuthnStatement element.
trans-unit.target: The following shows a sample AuthnStatement element.
